stanza.line: So is it not with me as with that (a)muse(/a)
Stirred by a painted beauty to his (b)verse(/b)
Who heaven it self for ornament doth (a)use(/a)
And every fair with his fair doth (b)rehearse(/b)
With sun and moon with earth and sea's rich (d)gems(/d)
With April's first-born flowers and all things (c)rare(/c)
That heaven's air in this huge rondure (d)hems(/d)
O let me true in love but truly (e)write(/e)
And then believe me my love is as (f)fair(/f)
As any mother's child though not so (e)bright(/e)
As those gold candles fixed in heaven's (f)air(/f)
Let them say more that like of hearsay (g)well(/g)
I will not praise that purpose not to (g)sell(/g)
